cluster_summary: The cluster is generally healthy with all nodes ready, no pending pods, and stable scheduling. Resource usage shows a mix of bursty, underutilized, and memory-saturated workloads, with HPAs functioning as expected. No immediate availability risks are observed, but efficiency and memory risk require attention.

patterns.description: One deployment shows significant CPU burstiness with high tail latency compared to average usage.
evidence: CPU avg 0.45 cores vs P99 2.1 cores
HPA scaling_status CAUTION with AT_CPU_THRESHOLD flag

patterns.description: A frontend deployment is consistently underutilizing allocated CPU and memory across replicas.
A batch workload is consistently operating at full memory allocation, limiting scaling flexibility.
Both nodes show moderate CPU and memory fragmentation, reducing packing efficiency.

warnings.description: The background-worker is fully consuming its allocated memory, increasing the risk of OOM events and limiting recovery options.
evidence: p99 memory close to max allocation

warnings.description: CPU and memory burstiness in the API server may trigger scaling events or transient latency under load spikes.
The web-frontend is overprovisioned relative to observed load, leading to inefficient resource usage.
evidence: current replicas higher than desired replicas

action_candidates.description: Review application-level memory behavior of the background-worker to understand sustained high memory usage.
action_candidates.expected_impact: Improved understanding of memory pressure and reduced risk of unexpected OOM events.
prerequisites: Access to application logs and profiling data

action_candidates.description: Closely observe API server HPA behavior during peak periods to validate responsiveness to CPU bursts.
action_candidates.expected_impact: Reduced uncertainty around scaling responsiveness during traffic spikes.

action_candidates.description: Review and approve the pending downscale suggested by the web-frontend HPA.
action_candidates.expected_impact: Lower baseline resource consumption and improved node packing efficiency.
prerequisites: Confirmation that current traffic levels are representative

priorities: Highest priority is addressing memory saturation in the background-worker due to its high risk and lack of scaling flexibility. Medium priority is monitoring the bursty API server to ensure stability under load. Lower priority is efficiency improvement by reviewing the web-frontend downscale.
limitations: Analysis is limited to metrics and flags provided by Phase-1; no application-level context is included.
No historical trend duration beyond provided percentiles is available.
Node analysis indicates no insufficient_data flags, but workload-to-node placement dynamics over time are not visible.
